trans-unit.source: Parallel Bulk Data Import Using SQL Partition Tables | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Parallel Bulk Data Import Using SQL Partition Tables | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Parallel Bulk Data Import Using SQL Partition Tables
trans-unit.target: Parallel Bulk Data Import Using SQL Partition Tables

trans-unit.source: For big data loading/transfer to an SQL database, importing data to the SQL DB and subsequent queries can be improved by using Partitioned Tables and Views.
trans-unit.target: For big data loading/transfer to an SQL database, importing data to the SQL DB and subsequent queries can be improved by using Partitioned Tables and Views.

trans-unit.source: This document describes how to build partitioned table(s) for fast parallel bluk importing of data to a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: This document describes how to build partitioned table(s) for fast parallel bluk importing of data to a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a new database</linkText><title></title> (if not exists)
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a new database</linkText><title></title> (if not exists)

trans-unit.source: Add database filegroups to the database which will hold the partitioned physical files
trans-unit.target: Add database filegroups to the database which will hold the partitioned physical files

trans-unit.source: Note: This can be done with <linkText>CREATE DATABASE</linkText><title></title> if new or <linkText>ALTER DATABASE</linkText><title></title> if database exists already
trans-unit.target: Note: This can be done with <linkText>CREATE DATABASE</linkText><title></title> if new or <linkText>ALTER DATABASE</linkText><title></title> if database exists already

trans-unit.source: Add one or more files (as needed) to each database filegroup
trans-unit.target: Add one or more files (as needed) to each database filegroup

trans-unit.source: Specify the target filegroup which will hold data for this partition and the physical database file name(s) where the filegroup data will be stored.
trans-unit.target: Specify the target filegroup which will hold data for this partition and the physical database file name(s) where the filegroup data will be stored.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a new database with three filegroups other than the primary and log groups, containing one physical file in each.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a new database with three filegroups other than the primary and log groups, containing one physical file in each.

trans-unit.source: The database files are created in the default SQL Server Data folder, as configured in the SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: The database files are created in the default SQL Server Data folder, as configured in the SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the default file locations, see <linkText>File Locations for Default and Named Instances of SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the default file locations, see <linkText>File Locations for Default and Named Instances of SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create partitioned table(s) according to the data schema, mapped to the database filegroups created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Create partitioned table(s) according to the data schema, mapped to the database filegroups created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: When data is bulk imported to the partitioned table(s), records will be distributed among the filegroups according to a partition scheme, as described below.
trans-unit.target: When data is bulk imported to the partitioned table(s), records will be distributed among the filegroups according to a partition scheme, as described below.

trans-unit.source: To create a partition table, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To create a partition table, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a partition function which defines the range of values/boundaries to be included in each individual partition table, e.g., to limit partitions by month(some\datetime\field) in the year 2013:
trans-unit.target: Create a partition function which defines the range of values/boundaries to be included in each individual partition table, e.g., to limit partitions by month(some\datetime\field) in the year 2013:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a partition scheme</linkText><title></title> which maps each partition range in the partition function to a physical filegroup, e.g.:
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a partition scheme</linkText><title></title> which maps each partition range in the partition function to a physical filegroup, e.g.:

trans-unit.source: Tip: To verify the ranges in effect in each partition according to the function/scheme, run the following query:
trans-unit.target: Tip: To verify the ranges in effect in each partition according to the function/scheme, run the following query:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create partitioned table</linkText><title></title>(s) according to your data schema, and specify the partition scheme and constraint field used to partition the table, e.g.:
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create partitioned table</linkText><title></title>(s) according to your data schema, and specify the partition scheme and constraint field used to partition the table, e.g.:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Create Partitioned Tables and Indexes</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Create Partitioned Tables and Indexes</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You may use BCP, BULK INSERT, or other methods such as <linkText>SQL Server Migration Wizard</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You may use BCP, BULK INSERT, or other methods such as <linkText>SQL Server Migration Wizard</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The example provided uses the BCP method.
trans-unit.target: The example provided uses the BCP method.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Alter the database</linkText><title></title> to change transaction logging scheme to BULK_LOGGED to minimize overhead of logging, e.g.:
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Alter the database</linkText><title></title> to change transaction logging scheme to BULK_LOGGED to minimize overhead of logging, e.g.:

trans-unit.source: To expedite data loading, launch the bulk import operations in parallel.
trans-unit.target: To expedite data loading, launch the bulk import operations in parallel.

trans-unit.source: For tips on expediting bulk importing of big data into SQL Server databases, see <linkText>Load 1TB in less than 1 hour</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For tips on expediting bulk importing of big data into SQL Server databases, see <linkText>Load 1TB in less than 1 hour</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following PowerShell script is an example of parallel data loading using BCP.
trans-unit.target: The following PowerShell script is an example of parallel data loading using BCP.

trans-unit.source: If you will extract data for modeling from multiple tables, create indexes on the join keys to improve the join performance.
trans-unit.target: If you will extract data for modeling from multiple tables, create indexes on the join keys to improve the join performance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create indexes</linkText><title></title> (clustered or non-clustered) targeting the same filegroup for each partition, for e.g.:
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create indexes</linkText><title></title> (clustered or non-clustered) targeting the same filegroup for each partition, for e.g.:

trans-unit.source: You may choose to create the indexes before bulk importing the data.
trans-unit.target: You may choose to create the indexes before bulk importing the data.

trans-unit.source: Index creation before bulk importing will slow down the data loading.
trans-unit.target: Index creation before bulk importing will slow down the data loading.

trans-unit.source: For an end-to-end walkthrough example using the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT) with a public dataset, see <linkText>Advanced Analytics Process and Technology in Action: using SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an end-to-end walkthrough example using the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT) with a public dataset, see <linkText>Advanced Analytics Process and Technology in Action: using SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.
